business.headline: Bollywood to cricket: Which celebs have lined up for Swiggy's blockbuster IPOThe final size of the IPO could increase by Rs 1,250 crore, bringing the total to Rs 11,664 crore or $1.4 billion, depending on the decisions made at the company's EGM scheduled for October 3.

Mahatma Gandhi wasn't 1st choice for India's currency. Here's what happenedThe currency notes from the 1950s and 60s featured images of animals like tigers and deer, along with symbols of India's development, such as the Hirakud Dam, the Aryabhatta satellite, and the Brihadeeswara Temple.
What is Mutual Fund Lite? All you need to knowThe aim of the Mutual Fund Lite framework is to simplify the rules for managing passively managed mutual funds.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as banking sector downturn offsets IT surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 33.49 points to end at 84,266.29, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 13.95 points to close at 25,796.90.

RVNL shares down 19% from record high. Good time to buy? RVNL shares have corrected nearly 19% from its record high of Rs 647. Is now a good time to invest in RVNL stock, or should investors wait for clearer signals? Read on to know more.

New life insurance rules from today: What it means for you? As of October 1, policyholders will now be eligible for a guaranteed surrender value from the first year, even if they have only paid one annual premium. However, these new regulations are expected to lower returns for policyholders over time.
Explained: Why Paytm shares jumped over 7% todayAt 2:56 pm, shares of Paytm were trading over 7.02% higher at Rs 736.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

This smallcap EV stock is up 38,000% in 5 years. Have you invested? In just a month, the company's shares have gained over 83% and over 168% in a year. In the past five years, the stock has gained a whopping 38,900%.

Who is Ravi Ahuja, the incoming CEO of Sony Pictures?As he steps into the CEO role, Ravi Ahuja will succeed Tony Vinciquerra, who will remain with SPE as a non-executive chairman until December 2025.

Check latest interest rates on PPF, SCSS, SSY and more The post office savings schemes included in this decision are the Public Provident Fund (PPF), Senior Citizen Savings Scheme (SCSS), Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY), and a few others.

Consumers await fuel price relief as OMCs pocket huge gainsDespite falling crude prices and record profits, consumers are still waiting for meaningful reductions in fuel prices, even as oil marketing companies are reaping huge benefits.

Google pays $2.7 billion to bring back AI visionary Noam ShazeerNoam Shazeer, 48, was one of Google's early hires, joining the company in 2000. A talented software engineer, Shazeer made his mark in AI, becoming a key figure in Google's early AI development.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: World Exclusive: First pics of bombed Hezbollah headquarters, India Today on siteIndia Today TV's Ashraf Wani, the only Indian reporter on the ground in Lebanon, was given access to the site of Hezbollah headquarters in Beirut that was destroyed in Israeli bombardment last week.

8 Israeli soldiers killed in Lebanon, Netanyahu slams 'Iran's Axis of Evil'Iran-Israel war: The Israeli military did not provide any details on how its soldiers were killed but had earlier stated that there had been "close-range" fighting with Hezbollah. The clashes occurred on the second day of Israel's ground invasion of southern Lebanon.

Vinesh Phogat claims she refused to speak to PM Modi after Olympics, reveals reasonVinesh Phogat claimed that she refused to speak to PM Modi after the Paris Olympics fiasco. She said she would have appreciated a genuine conversation with the Prime Minister without any conditions to publicise it.

'First-rate' women don't marry farmers' sons: Maharashtra MLA's remark sparks rowMaharashtra MLA Devendra Bhuyar said that only girls who are "at the bottom of the lot" marry a boy from a farming family.

Actor Samantha rebukes Telangana minister linking KTR to her divorceActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu addressed remarks by Congress leader Konda Surekha, who alleged a political role in her divorce from Naga Chaitanya. The actor urged that her name be kept out of political battles.

UP court links 'love jihad' to foreign funding, hands life term to Muslim manThe judge claimed that some groups are luring Hindu women into relationships to force illegal religious conversions, which he believes threaten India's unity and security.

Iran's Khamenei warned Hezbollah's Nasrallah of Israeli plot to kill him: ReportIn the immediate aftermath of the attack on Hezbollah's booby-trapped pagers on September 17, Khamenei sent a message with an envoy to beseech the Hezbollah secretary general to leave for Iran.

Watch: Newlyweds' first dance in Jerusalem bomb shelter as Iran rained missilesA newlywed couple in Jerusalem shared their first dance in an underground bunker, just as Iran launched nearly 200 ballistic missiles toward Israel on Tuesday.

Bengaluru bus conductor asks passenger not to stand on footboard, gets stabbedAfter the attack, the accused was caught by the bus's passengers and handed over to the police. He used to work at one of the call centres in Bengaluru and was discharged from his duties in September this year.

Why Zakir Naik might feel at home in PakistanPakistan has rolled out the red carpet for radical Islamic preacher Zakir Naik, who is wanted in India for inciting communal disharmony and laundering money. It is Pakistan where Zakir Naik, who resides in Malaysia now, might feel at home.

Video showing Congress worker taking off Siddaramaiah's shoes sparks rowA Congress worker was caught on camera removing the Chief Minister's shoes as he arrived at an event to pay tribute to Mahatma Gandhi on his birth anniversary in Bengaluru.
Video: Pune techie, wife in car chased by mob, attacked with sticks, stonesA man in Pune said that around 40 people attacked him and his wife as they were driving on Lavale-Nande Road.

Iran-Israel conflict: Who's backing whom as Middle East stares at warIran-Israel War: The Israel-Hamas conflict has pulled in an ever-widening web of countries and militias, from Lebanon to Iran. The prospect of a war in the Middle East raises one key question. Which country is on whose side?

Anushka Sharma sets the rules as Virat Kohli plays cricket in this hilarious videoAnushka Sharma and Virat Kohli teamed up for a playful cricket match in a new advertisement. While the match itself was lighthearted, Anushka's unexpected twist left Virat slightly bewildered. The adorable video quickly went viral on social media.

WATCH LIVE: Annular Solar Eclipse turns the sun into a 'Ring of Fire'Viewers will witness the Moon perfectly centred within the Sun's disk, creating the iconic ring of fire for up to 7 minutes and 25 seconds.

Israel and Iran, now sworn enemies, tackled a foe togetherIran, Israel's sworn enemy, rained a barrage of missiles on Israel on Tuesday. The Iran-Israel conflict is four-decades old. However, what might surprise many is that they were once allies who even cooperated militarily and commercially. This is how two allies became sworn enemies.

Prashant Kishor officially launches Jan Suraaj Party in PatnaAt the launch event, Kishore stated that the party has been active for the past two years and recently received approval from the Election Commission of India.

Actor Mukesh Khanna calls Kapil Sharma Show vulgar, comedian unculturedActor Mukesh Khanna criticised Kapil Sharma and called him uncultured, sharing his reasons. He also shared why he never appeared on The Kapil Sharma Show.

Sharad Pawar moves Supreme Court over use of 'clock' symbol by nephew Ajit's partyIn his plea, Sharad Pawar argues that Ajit Pawar should apply for a new election symbol to avoid confusion among voters. The petition emphasises the importance of maintaining fairness and clarity during the electoral process.

Israel declares UN chief persona non grata over 'failure to condemn' Iran attackIsrael banned the entry of UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres into the country, saying he failed to "unequivocally condemn" Iran's massive missile attack.

Fattah-2: How Iran used hypersonic missile to pierce Israel's air defenceIran's missile barrage against Israel on Tuesday marked the first combat deployment of its advanced hypersonic medium-range "Fattah-2" ballistic missile.

Doctor pleads guilty in Matthew Perry's drug overdose caseDr Mark Chavez, pleaded guilty to a charge of illegally distributing the drug ketamine. At sentencing, he could face up to 10 years in prison.

Stranger Things actor Millie Bobby Brown shares pictures from her weddingMillie Bobby Brown married Jake Bongiovi in an intimate ceremony in May. The couple has now shared stunning wedding pictures on Instagram.

Watch: Aamir Khan's daughter Ira takes an auto after visiting mother Reena DuttaIra khan and her husband, trainer Nupur Shikhare took an auto after they exited Khan's mother, Reena Dutta's residence. They paid a visit after Dutta's father, and Khan's grandfather died a few days back. Fatima Sana Shaikh was also seen, along with Aamir Khan's sister Nikhat. Aamir Khan has been paying Dutta visits continuously and was seen today as well.

sports.headline: After T20I upset, South Africa thump Ireland by 139 runs to take 1-0 lead in ODIsSouth Africa registered a thumping win against Ireland by 139 runs to take a 1-0 lead in the ODI series. Ryaan Rickelton was named as the Player of the Match for his 91-run knock.

Alcaraz and Sinner play out incredible rally in China OpenCarlos Alcaraz edged past defending champion Jannik Sinner in a thrilling China Open final, overcoming a set deficit and winning 6-7(6), 6-4, 7-6(3) after three hours and 21 minutes. This victory marks Alcaraz's fourth title of the season.

Can Harmanpreet Kaur's India overcome the Australia, England threat?  Women's T20 World Cup 2024: India are yet to win the title despite playing in the knock-out stages in the last three editions of the tournament. Can the Harmanpreet Kaur-led team finally get their hands on the trophy? Can India take down heavyweights like Australia and England?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
